<target_code>
Here is the code of producer_thread:
```c
static void *producer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (counter == COUNTER_MAX)
		metal_condition_wait(&nfull_condv, &lock);
	counter++;
	metal_condition_signal(&nempty_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function producer_thread:
int metal_condition_wait(struct metal_condition *cv,
				       metal_mutex_t *m)
{
	uintptr_t tmpmptr = 0, mptr = (uintptr_t)m;
	int v = 0;

	/* Check if the mutex has been acquired */
	if (!cv || !m || !metal_mutex_is_acquired(m))
		return -EINVAL;

	if (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&cv->mptr, &tmpmptr, mptr)) {
		if (tmpmptr != mptr)
			return -EINVAL;
	}

	v = atomic_load(&cv->wakeups);
	atomic_fetch_add(&cv->waiters, 1);

	/* Release the mutex before sleeping. */
	metal_mutex_release(m);
	syscall(SYS_futex, &cv->wakeups, FUTEX_WAIT, v, NULL, NULL, 0);
	atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
	/* Acquire the mutex after it's waken up. */
	metal_mutex_acquire(m);

	return 0;
}
</additional code>

explanation: I selected the complete producer_thread and the full metal_condition_wait implementation because recursion concerns arise from calls between these functions and the mutex/condition operations they invoke. Other code fragments in the provided snippets do not need further investigation for Rule 17.2: - The atomic_* operations (atomic_compare_exchange_strong, atomic_load, atomic_fetch_add, atomic_fetch_sub) are standard library/atomic intrinsics and do not perform user-level function calls that could indirectly recurse to producer_thread. - The syscall(SYS_futex, ...) is a kernel syscall; it does not call back into user-space functions and therefore cannot create indirect recursion to producer_thread. - The simple checks/returns (if (!cv || !m ...), return -EINVAL, return 0, return NULL) are non-calling statements and cannot produce recursion. - metal_mutex_is_acquired is a query routine; unless its implementation (not provided) calls back into producer_thread, it is not a recursion source. Because the implementations of metal_mutex_acquire, metal_mutex_release, metal_condition_signal and any other mutex/condition helpers are not provided, I included the calling sites (the two full functions above) so other investigators can inspect those missing implementations for possible indirect recursion. No other fragments in the provided code can introduce direct or indirect self-calls to producer_thread.
